org.xlattice.protocol.stun

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.protocol.stun.Server

  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    A STUN server which listens for UDP BindingRequests on four combinations of primary/secondary IP address and primary/secondary port and optionally listens for SharedSecretRequests on TLS (TCP) connections to the primary IP address and port. By default the primary port is 3478. XXX NEED TO CLEAN UP CODE RELATING TO THIS CLASS EXTENDING Thread
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(java.lang.String primary,
      java.lang.String secondary,
      int p,
      int q,
      java.lang.String keyStoreName,
      java.lang.String passwd,
      java.lang.String logDir,
      boolean authenticating,
      boolean verbose)
       throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
              java.net.SocketException,
              StunException
        Creates a server instance, setting parameters first from the values passed, then if there are no such values from system properties, then if there are no such system properties from the SERVER_PROPERTIES_FILE file, and lastly by default. If for some reason the server is not able to provide authentication, it proceeds without it. XXX There is no way to make the authentication optional.
        Parameters:
        primary - primary IPv4 address; may be null
        secondary - secondary IPv4 address; may be null
        p - primary port; -1 if not specified
        q - secondary port; -1 if not specifieid
        keyStoreName - key store file name; or null
        passwd - passphrase in String format; or null
        logDir - name of directory to write log to
        authenticating - whether the server supports shared secrets
        verbose - whether to talk a lot
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if a port isn't numeric
        java.net.SocketException - if BindingSender can't open socket
        StunException - if problem resolving host name
